metadata.title: CVE-2021-33033 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The Linux kernel before 5.11.14 has a use-after-free in cipso_v4_genopt innet/ipv4/cipso_ipv4.c because the CIPSO and CALIPSO refcounting for the DOIdefinitions is mishandled, aka CID-ad5d07f4a9cd. This leads to writing anarbitrary value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33033` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-144-generic - 4.15.0-144.148
linux-image-4.15.0-144-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-144.148
linux-image-4.15.0-144-lowlatency - 4.15.0-144.148
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-144-generic - 4.15.0-144.148
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-144-lowlatency - 4.15.0-144.148
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-73-generic - 5.4.0-73.82~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-73-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-73.82~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-73-lowlatency - 5.4.0-73.82~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-73-generic - 5.4.0-73.82~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-73-lowlatency - 5.4.0-73.82~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1092-kvm - 4.15.0-1092.94
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1103-aws - 4.15.0-1103.110
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-144.148').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-73.82~18.04.1').
